title: Theory of Hallucinations based on Equivariance. (arXiv:2312.14504v2 [cs.CL] UPDATED)
abstract: This study aims to acquire knowledge for creating very large language models that are immune to hallucinations. Hallucinations in contemporary large language models are often attributed to a misunderstanding of real-world social relationships. Therefore, I hypothesize that very large language models capable of thoroughly grasping all these relationships will be free from hallucinations. Additionally, I propose that certain types of equivariant language models are adept at learning and understanding these relationships. Building on this, I have developed a specialized cross-entropy error function to create a hallucination scale for language models, which measures their extent of equivariance acquisition. Utilizing this scale, I tested language models for their ability to acquire character-level equivariance. translated_title: 基于等变性的幻觉理论
translated_abstract: 本研究旨在获取创建对幻觉免疫的大型语言模型所需的知识。现代大型语言模型中的幻觉往往归因于对现实社交关系的误解。因此，我假设能够彻底掌握所有这些关系的大型语言模型将不会出现幻觉。此外，我提出了某些类型的等变语言模型在学习和理解这些关系方面表现出色。在此基础上，我开发了一种专门用于创建语言模型幻觉程度的交叉熵误差函数，该函数衡量了它们获得等变性的程度。利用这个指标，我测试了语言模型在获得字符级等变性方面的能力。特别地，我引入并采用了一种基于T5（文本到文本转换变压器）的新技术，可以高效地理解经过排列的输入文本而无需解释。
tldr: 本研究提出了基于等变性的幻觉理论，探讨了大型语言模型中幻觉的成因，并开发了一种衡量语言模型幻觉程度的交叉熵误差函数。通过测试语言模型在获得等变性方面的能力，研究表明某些类型的等变语言模型对理解复杂社交关系表现出色。
en_tdlr: This study presents a theory of hallucinations based on equivariance in large language models. It proposes a specialized cross-entropy error function to measure the extent of hallucinations in language models. The study also demonstrates the efficacy of certain types of equivariant language models in understanding complex social relationships.
